intro: Descurainia athrocarpa, commonly known as narrowleaf tansy, is an annual flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress species. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, and it produces small, elongated pods that contain several seeds. It typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in fields and along roadsides.
